page.title: 05CUSTOMS IN TILSTON
page.content: The{Rush bearing Festival}is an ancient annual custom of Tilston that takes place during the{Wakes.}(See {EVENTS IN TILSTON.) }It is a relic of the time when fresh rushes were placed on the earthen floor of houses.In late August, rushes are gathered from the local ponds and are used to decorate the{graves and church}which are also decorated with flowers. There is a Rushbearing{Service}on the last Sunday in August. No one knows the origin of this custom but there are similar customs in nearby villages e.g. Shocklach. The local Methodist Chapel has an annual{Songs of Praise}Sunday. Many local people take part by singing or by playing musical instruments. There is a Rememberance Sunday Parade led by the Ex-service men with the guides & brownies.{Harvest Sunday}is an annual event.
